intro: Cussonia homblei, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers followed by bright red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine. Cussonia homblei thrives in moist, shaded environments and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
